project_abstract.cdata: The objectives of Hurricane Tomas Emergency Recovery Project for St. Vincent and the Grenadines are to support the Recipient's efforts to: i) rehabilitate damaged and vulnerable infrastructure, caused by the passage of Hurricane Tomas; and, ii) strengthen the Recipient's ability to analyze location specific risks. This project has 3 components. Component 1 comprises of rehabilitation of vulnerable and damaged infrastructure. Carrying out the rehabilitation and reconstruction of damaged infrastructure, including, inter alia, school buildings and associated school infrastructure, community centers, strengthening a river defense site, stock-piling gabion baskets, and transport infrastructure, through the provision of works, technical advisory services and goods. Component 2 is institutional strengthening and hazard and risk analysis. Improving the capacity of the Ministry of Housing, Informal Human Settlements, Lands and Surveys and Physical Planning (MoHILP), and the National Emergency Management Organization (NEMO), for evaluation of natural hazard and climate change risks, through the provision of training to the respective staff of MoHLP and NEMO, provision of technical advisory services and acquisition of goods. Component 3 is project management and implementation support. Strengthening and developing the institutional capacity of the Public Sector Investment Program Management Unit for Project management and execution, including procurement, financial management and supervision of Project activities, through the acquisition of goods, provision of technical advisory services, training, and operating costs.
